comments.content: Logen Ninefingers is one of the most compelling characters I've ever read. Abercrombie's gritty style is refreshing!
The character development in this book is outstanding. Glokta's chapters are always a highlight.
What an ending! Abercrombie really knows how to subvert expectations. Bayaz is such a complex character.
Monza's quest for revenge is brutal and captivating. The way Abercrombie weaves in characters from the original trilogy is masterful.
The way this book captures the chaos and futility of war is incredible. Gorst's inner monologue is both hilarious and disturbing.
A perfect blend of fantasy and western themes. The return of a certain character had me cheering!
Abercrombie does an amazing job of showing how technology changes society. Savine is a fascinating character.
The political maneuvering in this book is top-notch. Orso's development is particularly well-done.
A fitting end to the trilogy. The way Abercrombie explores the consequences of revolution is thought-provoking.
